title: The Rush Limbaugh Show Podcast
itunes:title: The Rush Limbaugh Show Podcast
description:
PODCAST SUMMARY HOUR 1:

Rush gives cancer treatment update: Waking up each day is a blessing. Why Trump punches down at Joe Scarborough. The lockdown goalposts keep moving. Fauci flips on lockdown. Democrats scared to death of economic rebound. Former CBS news chief admits liberal bias in media. The lockdown wasn't necessary. Data shows that left-demanded mass transit fueled coronavirus transmission, 42% of deaths in nursing homes. Biden's Memorial Day mask, racists comments about black voters.

PODCAST SUMMARY HOUR 2:

Tom Brady has a bad golf day at The Match. Rush talks about his cancer symptoms, phases of treatment. Why Trump trusted the health experts on lockdown. COVID-19 death rate is much lower than original projections. World economy was shut down for a virus just twice as deadly as seasonal flu. What shutdown has done is spread pandemic of fear, exposed the sheep among us from the liberty loving. Democrats never promise to improve the lives of African-Americans, only to punish the people who wronged them. Millennial caller concerned about impact of fellow Millennials who would rather not work. Drive-Bys celebrate "grim milestone" of 100,000 coronavirus deaths, which they can blame on Trump.

PODCAST SUMMARY HOUR 3:

NFL plans to play with full stadiums in November. Lockdown was one of worst mistakes in history. Fauci admits lockdown could do "irreparable damage." White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany is a Rush Baby, getting grief from press. Carville calls Trump fat, says Jill Stein is a Russian agent. Oxford researchers worried there aren't enough COVID-19 patients to test a vaccine. Trump threatens to pull RNC out of North Carolina if Democrat governor won't ease lockdown restrictions. Kayleigh McEnany echoes Rush on Trump and Scarborough.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Follow Clay & Buck on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/clayandbuck

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
